name: A
description: "Agouti series", affects distribution of both eumelanin and phaeomelanin

genes.name: Sable
genes.description: Red with or without black tipping.

genes.name: Agouti
genes.description: Banded hairs. The gene responsible for wolf grey.

genes.name: Tan points
genes.description: Black body with red on muzzle, chest, eyebrows, legs and vent.

genes.name: Recessive black
genes.description: Solid black with no red in the coat at all.

genes.name: Normal pigment
genes.description: A Bb or BB dog produces normal black eumelanin.

genes.name: Normal pigment
genes.description: A bb dog produces liver eumelanin instead of black.

genes.name: Normal pigment
genes.description: Normal black or liver pigment.

genes.name: Diluted pigment
genes.description: When homozygous (dd), turns black to blue and liver to isabella.

genes.name: Non-cocoa
genes.description: Normal pigment.

genes.name: Cocoa
genes.description: Brown eumalanin, similar to liver.

genes.name: Masked
genes.description: Black on the muzzle and the ears, and sometimes spreading to black tipping on the chest and/or back.

genes.name: Normal extension
genes.description: No restriction of pigment.

genes.name: Grizzle/Domino
genes.description: Found only in certain sighthound breeds.

genes.name: Northern domino
genes.description: Found only in Northern and some primitive breeds.

genes.name: Cocker Spaniel sable
genes.description: Found only in Cocker Spaniels. Requires tan points (atat) in order to be expressed.

genes.name: Recessive red
genes.description: Solid red all over, except for white markings.

name: G
description: "Greying series", affects how eumelanin keeps its intensity over time

genes.name: Progressive greying
genes.description: A dog with one or two G genes will be born dark-coloured and its hair will lighten over time.

genes.name: Normal
genes.description: No lightening of pigment.

genes.name: Harlequin
genes.description: Areas between patches on a merle dog are turned to white, leaving solid pigmented patches on a white base. Only works with merle gene and does not affect non-merle dogs.

genes.name: Non-harlequin
genes.description: Normal expression of merle.

name: I
description: "Intensity series", affects the richness of phaeomelanin

genes.name: Normal
genes.description: No lightening of pigment.

genes.name: Diluted
genes.description: Diluted/pale phaeomelanin.

genes.name: Black
genes.description: Solid black all over.

genes.name: Brindle
genes.description: Black stripes on a red base.

genes.name: Non-solid black
genes.description: A kyky dog will express whichever genes are on its A locus.

genes.name: Cryptic merle
genes.description: Will appear solid-colored.

genes.name: Atypical merle
genes.description: Some merling may be visible, but it may be greyish.

genes.name: Normal merle
genes.description: Black patches on a grey base.

genes.name: Harlequin merle
genes.description: Some areas of pigment are diluted to white.

genes.name: Non-merle
genes.description: Normal expression of eumelanin.

name: S
description: "spotting series", affects distribution of all pigment

genes.name: No white
genes.description: Al of coat is pigmented - no white spotting, or minimal white spotting.

genes.name: Piebald
genes.description: Varying pigmented patches on a white base.

genes.name: Irish spotting
genes.description: White on muzzle, neck, chest, feet and tail tip.

name: T
description: "ticking series", affects distribution of all pigment

genes.name: Ticking
genes.description: White areas are ticked with small flecks or spots of colour.

genes.name: Roan
genes.description: More dense than ticking.

genes.name: Clear white
genes.description: No ticking on white areas.

genes.name: Non-albino
genes.description: Normal pigment

genes.name: Albino
genes.description: Pigment diluted to off-white.
